page.title: 12Basingstoke Memorial Park
page.content: The Goldings was a{Georgian Mansion built onto two 16th Century Elizabethan houses.It was bought with its{parkland}by the people of Basingstoke for a{War Memorial}after the{First World War.}Men of both Wars are remembered on a{Monument}which has an{Angel of Victory}on top.There is a wall. We think it has 405 bricks on top layer.In the park{children}have their own{play area.}There are {swings,roundabouts,slides,sandpits and two{climbing frames.}There are {Tennis Courts,}Croquet,Netball.There is a small{Avery}with{buderigars.}The {Carnival}and{Fair}is held every year when the industies{advertise}their {wares}and collect for{charites.}We can hear{music}on the{bandstand.}We found many types of{trees}in the park. In the park we saw two men cutting the {hedges}around the{Bandstand.
